cyclone.name: CLAUDETTE
cyclone.category: Tropical Storm (35 mph – below SSHS Cat-1)
cyclone.current_location: about 310 miles south of Morgan City, Louisiana
cyclone.trajectory: Tracking north toward the north-central Gulf Coast, then forecast to turn northeast and move across Alabama and Georgia toward the Carolinas/Atlantic coast.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: north-central Gulf Coast near the Louisiana coastline (around Morgan City)

weather_observation.warning_coast: Intracoastal City, LA to Okaloosa/Walton County line, FL (including Lake Pontchartrain, Lake Maurepas and Metropolitan New Orleans)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast (LA–FL Panhandle) then inland MS, AL, and across central/ southern Georgia to the Atlantic coast
weather_observation.wind: Breezy conditions with occasional tropical-storm-force gusts (20–35 mph) possible Sunday as the weakening system passes inland west of the port.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected along the Georgia Atlantic coast.
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of heavy rain Sunday into Monday could produce 3–5 inches (locally higher) and cause flash-flooding in the Savannah area.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes in rainbands and hazardous seas/rip currents along adjacent Atlantic waters.
